name: Necromancer's Magemark
text:
Enchant creature
Creatures you control that are enchanted get +1/+1.
If a creature you control that's enchanted would die, return it to its owner's hand instead.

name: Necromancer's Stockpile
text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Draw a card. If the discarded card was a Zombie card, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

editions.flavor: The experiments decided to perform some research of their own.

name: Necromancy
text:
You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
When Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

name: Necromantic Selection
text: Destroy all creatures, then return a creature card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control. It's a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types. Exile Necromantic Selection.

editions.flavor: It shambled from the cloud of ash and bone dust, undeterred by its own extinction.

name: Necromantic Summons
text:
Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, that creature enters the battlefield with two additional +1/+1 counters on it.

name: Necromantic Thirst
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Necromaster Dragon
text:
Flying
Whenever Necromaster Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token and each opponent puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Necropede
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Necropede dies, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

name: Necroplasm
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Necroplasm.
At the beginning of your end step, destroy each creature with converted mana cost equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on Necroplasm.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

name: Necropolis
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.

name: Necropolis Fiend
text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Flying
{X}, {T}, Exile X cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

name: Necropolis Regent
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put that many +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: "Jarad fancies himself king of the undercity, but he's merely king of rot."

name: Necropotence
text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

name: Necropotence Avatar
text:
Skip your draw step.
At the beginning of your end step, if it's not the first turn of the game, put a death counter on Necropotence Avatar. You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of death counters on Necropotence Avatar.

editions.flavor: ME2 Prize Avatar

name: Necropouncer
Necrosavant
text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Necroskitter
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls with a -1/-1 counter on it dies, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control.

name: Necrotic Ooze
text: As long as Necrotic Ooze is on the battlefield, it has all activated abilities of all creature cards in all graveyards.

editions.flavor:
"To death all must go, and so in death lies ultimate power."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault

name: Necrotic Plague
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature."
When enchanted creature dies, its controller chooses target creature one of his or her opponents controls. Return Necrotic Plague from its owner's graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

name: Necrotic Sliver
text: All Slivers have "{3}, Sacrifice this permanent: Destroy target permanent."

editions.flavor: Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.
Though Volrath is long dead, the slivers have become everything he wanted them to be: mindless instruments of destruction and despair.

name: Nectar Faerie
text:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Need for Speed
text: Sacrifice a land: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His feet buckled the ground, his hands cut the wind to ribbons, and he was gone.

name: Needlebite Trap
text:
If an opponent gained life this turn, you may pay {B} rather than pay Needlebite Trap's mana cost.
Target player loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: The traps around the vampire city of Malakir hint at the thirst of its inhabitants.

name: Needlebug
text:
Flash
Protection from artifacts

editions.flavor: Near Tel-Jilad, the Tangle is almost silent, save for the trolls' chants and the skittering of needlebugs.

name: Needle Drop
text:
Needle Drop deals 1 damage to target creature or player that was dealt damage this turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"First it was plovers and mulldrifters. Now it's knitting needles the size of javelins."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

name: Needlepeak Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
"It's a testament to the forests' devastation that giant spiders now make their homes amid Dominaria's barren spires."
—Aznaph, greenseeker

name: Needleshot Gourna
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: The first aven scout squad returned from Krosa with disturbing stories. The second returned with disturbing casualties.

name: Needle Specter
text:
Flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Needle Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards that many cards.

text:

{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
{2}{R}{W}: Needle Spires becomes a 2/1 red and white Elemental creature with double strike until end of turn. It's still a land.

name: Needle Storm
text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.
The rain is driven like nails.

If damage would be dealt to you, exile that many cards from your graveyard instead. If you can't, you lose the game.

text:
Trample
You may exert Nef-Crop Entangler as it attacks. When you do, it gets +1/+2 until end of turn. (An exerted creature won't untap during your next untap step.)

editions.flavor: "If you do not feel the thrill of battle, alive like a flame, you will never triumph."

text: Counter target noncreature spell.

—Jace Beleren

First strike

Nekrataal

First strike

text:
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.
Whenever an opponent draws a card, Nekusar, the Mindrazer deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Nemesis of Reason
text: Whenever Nemesis of Reason attacks, defending player puts the top ten cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Words describing it fail. Pages relating it shrivel. Tales recounting it end.

text:
If a white creature is attacking, you may pay {B}{B} rather than pay Nemesis Trap's mana cost.
Exile target attacking creature. Create a token that's a copy of that creature. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Nephalia
text:

Whenever you roll CHAOS, return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)

text:
Reach
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 4. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put four +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

text:
Tribute 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place three +1/+1 counters on it.)

text: When Nessian Game Warden enters the battlefield, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of Forests you control. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

text:
Tribute 6 (As this creature enters the battlefield, an opponent of your choice may place six +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Nessian Wilds Ravager enters the battlefield, if tribute wasn't paid, you may have Nessian Wilds Ravager fight another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

Trample

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

Haste
